qas.question: What is the term applied to the experience of the awakening of arahants?
In early Buddhism Bodhi used a meaning synonymous to what word?
What is the term for greed or craving?
what is the word for hate or aversion?

context: <a0_0>Bodhi<a0_0/> (Pāli and Sanskrit, in devanagari: बॊधि) is a term applied to the experience of Awakening of arahants. Bodhi literally means "awakening", but it is more commonly translated into English as "enlightenment". In Early Buddhism, bodhi carried a meaning synonymous to <a1_0>nirvana<a1_0/>, using only some different metaphors to describe the experience, which implies the extinction of <a2_0>raga<a2_0/> (greed, craving),[web 12] <a3_0>dosa<a3_0/> (hate, aversion)[web 13] and moha (<a4_0>delusion<a4_0/>).[web 14] In the later school of Mahayana Buddhism, the status of nirvana was downgraded in some scriptures, coming to refer only to the extinction of greed and hate, implying that delusion was still present in one who attained nirvana, and that one needed to attain bodhi to eradicate delusion:
